column4: Jookia, you can always blacklist kernel module ipv6 in /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist
so disabling VP6 would make my wireless work?
I don't know, I though you'd asked how to disable IPv6, I told you how, I didn't know what was leading to it, sorry
well, which wireless card do you have?
don't know, I had problems with an atheros a while ago, checking which one was
first of all, let me warn you, I told you that thing about IPv6 by mistake, I suppose I used the tab completion with the wrong nick ^^but anyway, I'll try to help you
you had it working before how? ndiswrapper?
well... use forums or google for it, it's the best I can say you... Use http://www.savagehamsters.com/?p=55 for a quickstart
can't tell you without having messed with that Atheros in particular more... Which I haven't :) (a firend of mine had that wireless card and I gave up trying to make it work on 7.10 :P)
Google, Forums, and you'll find something. The page I told you had windows drivers which worked well with ndiswrapper :)
me here but not here; done bathing, lunch now :)
